channel.title: USA.gov Updates
channel.description: Government news and featured content from the U.S. government's official website, USA.gov.

item.title: USAGov’s 11 National Parks You Can’t Miss in 2016
item.description: Check out some of USAGov’s favorite parks as chosen by our own staff.

item.title: USAGov’s College Voting Guide
item.description: As a college student you might have a choice about where to register to vote. Review USAGov’s college voting guide and learn about voting for college students.

item.title: Get Ready for School - 8 Tips for Parents from Kids.gov
item.description: The end of summer marks the start of a new school year. These tips can help you as you get your family ready for the upcoming academic year.

item.title: Heads Up - Learn About Concussions
item.description: Learn how to protect yourself from a concussion, to recognize its symptoms and to get medical treatment.

item.title: USAGov’s Tips for National Anthem Etiquette
item.description: These tips from USAGov, based on the U.S. Flag Code will help you know what to do anywhere the national anthem is played.

item.title: USAGov’s Top Five Questions for Election Season
item.description: USAGov answers the top five election season questions to get you ready for November 8.

item.title: The USAGov Contact Center Connects You to Answers from Your Government
item.description: Learn how USAGov's Contact Center connects you with your government.

item.title: USAGov’s Guide to Displaying the American Flag
item.description: This guide from USAGov, based on the Federal Flag Code, can help you show respect for the flag as you celebrate this Fourth of July.

item.title: USAGov’s Voting Guide for Military Members and Americans Abroad
item.description: USAGov is committed to informing and making sure members of the military, their families, and other Americans outside the U.S. don’t miss the chance to vote.

item.title: Critical Rx For a Healthy Home
item.description: Some people have health issues and may not realize their personal wellness and the health of their home are interconnected.

item.title: Discover Six of the Government's Best Mobile Apps
item.description: There’s an app for everything in this digital age, including hundreds developed by the federal government. Here are six apps that we found especially useful.

item.title: Support for Families When A Suicide Attempt Hits Home
item.description: Find resources that could help you and your family after a suicide attempt by a loved one.

item.title: USAGov’s Five Tips to Get Great Deals from Government Auctions and Sales
item.description: You may have heard that you can buy “stuff” from the government. But how does it work? Can you really get good deals?

item.title: Clinical trials: Seeking Diversity in Women for Better Testing
item.description: Check out these four recommendations if you’re thinking of participating in a clinical trial or learning more about them.
